item.title: Discovering Aphex Twin’s '#3' from *Selected Ambient Works Volume II* – A Hidden Gem
item.description:
Listening vibe: barely awake, calm, dreamy, atmospheric, cinematic

With A.I. AI-generated playlists fueling my music discovery, I’ve unearthed handfuls of new [to me] a trove of new-to-me gems. One in particualr that stands out is Aphex Twin’s Selected Ambient Works Volume II (1994), specifically the track “#3” [I’m listening to as I write this], which I’m spinning as I write. Known as Richard David James, Aphex Twin is a sonic alchemist whose humble understated sound can be easy to look passed slip past at first. I am fairly new to the genre but can say that This introspective ambient sound, new to me, is a rare vibe I’ve been chasing. It pulses with a heartbeat akin to Brian Eno or Boards of Canada. Selected Ambient Works Volume II was crafted in James’ Cornwall studio, often in lucid dream-like states, giving tracks like “#3” an otherworldly glow—perfect for late-night drifts. With A.I. giving all the suggestions these days, I look forward to continue the journey AI’s curated nudges make me eager to keep digging for music like this.
